data.title: Love's Labour's Lost (Rent or Buy)
data.meta_description:
Four young men swear off women to devote themselves to learning - only to fall for four attractive newcomers. Shakespeare's language reaches its most virtuosic heights in a vivacious comedy that will dazzle and delight.

By William Shakespeare
Directed for the Stage by John Caird
Directed for Film by Barry Avrich
Designer - Patrick Clark
Lighting Designer - Michael Walton
Composer - Josh Schmidt
Sound Designer - Peter McBoyle

Sanjay Talwar as King Ferdinand of Navarre
Mike Shara as Berowne
Andrew Robinson as Longaville
Thomas Olajide as Dumaine
Xuan Fraser as Forester
Robert King as Forester, Marcade
Juan Chioran as Don Adriano de Armado
Gabriel Long as Moth
Josh Johnston as Servant to Armado
Shruti Kothari as Servant to Armado
Tom Rooney as Holofernes
Brian Tree as Nathaniel
Brad Rudy as Dull
Josue Laboucane as Costard
Jennifer Mogbock as Jaquenetta
Ruby Joy as The Princess of France
Sarah Afful as Rosaline
Ijeoma Emesowum as Maria
Tiffany Claire Martin as Katherine
John Kirkpatrick as Boyet
Derek Moran as French Lord

Assistant Director - Krista Jackson
Assistant Set Designer - Mary-Jo Carter Dodd
Assistant Costume Designer - Alyssa Westman
Assistant Lighting Designer - Tristan Tidswell
Stage Manager - Janine Ralph
Assistant Stage Manager - Holly Korhonen
Assistant Stage Manager - Elizabeth McDermott
Production Assistant - Katherine Dermott
Production Stage Manager - Margaret Palmer
Technical Director - Jeff Scollon

Four young men swear off women to devote themselves to learning - only to fall for four attractive newcomers. Shakespeare's language reaches its most virtuosic heights in a vivacious comedy that will dazzle and delight.
